name: Who Am I?   [1] Trivia Quiz | UK | 25 Questions

questions.text: West Ham United - Manchester United - Inter Milan - Liverpool - Middlesborough - Wolverhampton Wanderers?
questions.explanation:
Paul Ince.

	Paul Ince was famously pictured wearing a Manchester United shirt whilst still a West Ham United player.

questions.text: Cruzeiro - PSV Eindhoven - Barcelona - Inter Milan - Real Madrid?
questions.explanation:
Ronaldo.

	Ronaldo's full name is Ronaldo Luis Naza De Lima.

questions.text: Leeds United - Blackburn Rovers - Newcastle United - Leeds United?
questions.explanation:
David Batty.

	Batty was involved in a famous bust up with his own team mate, Graeme Le Saux while playing for Blackburn Rovers in a European Cup match.

questions.text: Macclesfield Town - Luton Town - Arsenal - West Ham United - Wimbledon - Coventry City - Glasgow Celtic?
questions.explanation:
John Hartson.

	Amazingly Hartson was set to sign for Celtic's rivals Rangers until a failed medical halted the move. A few months later he signed for Celtic.

questions.text: Ajax Amsterdam - AC Milan - Juventus?
questions.explanation:
Edgar Davids.

	Davids has an eye disease which forces him to wear special spectacles when on the pitch.

questions.text: Crystal Palace - Arsenal - West Ham United - Nottingham Forest (Loan) - Glasgow Celtic - Burnley?
questions.explanation:
Ian Wright.

	Ian Wright set the Arsenal goalscoring record, surpassing the previous holder, Cliff Bastin.

questions.text: Ajax Amsterdam - Inter Milan - Arsenal?
questions.explanation:
Dennis Bergkamp.

	Dennis Bergkamp is named after the great Denis Law. His parents added an extra 'N' into his forename because they thought 'Denis' sounded too girlish.

questions.text: St. Johnstone - Sunderland - Glasgow Rangers - Kilmarnock?
questions.explanation:
Ally McCoist.

	In the early 2000s McCoist was a football pundid and team captain on BBC's 'A Question Of Sport'.

questions.text: Newell's Old Boys - River Plate - Boca Juniors - Fiorentina - AS Roma - Inter Milan (Loan)?
questions.explanation:
Gabriel Batistuta.

	Batistuta spent 9 years at Fiorentina, and scored 218 goals in the process.

questions.text: Newcastle United - Tottenham Hotspur - Marseilles - Sheffield Wednesday - Falkirk - Bradford City - Sunderland - Burnley - Torquay United - Worksop Town?
questions.explanation:
Chris Waddle.

	Chris Waddle released a single with Glenn Hoddle called 'Diamond Lights'.

questions.text: Millwall - Djurgaarden (Loan) - Aldershot (Loan) - Nottingham Forest - Tottenham Hotspur - Manchester United - Tottenham Hotspur?
questions.explanation:
Teddy Sheringham.

	Amazingly, until Sheringham signed for Manchester United, he had not won a trophy of any kind.

questions.text: Dundee United - Glasgow Rangers - Everton - Newcastle United - Everton?
questions.explanation:
Duncan Ferguson.

	Ferguson was sold by Rangers after being convicted of assault.

questions.text: Swansea City - Cardiff City (Loan) - Brighton and Hove Albion - Oxford United - Derby County - Liverpool - Aston Villa - Galatasaray - Nottingham Forest - Sheffield United - Benfica - Bradford City?
questions.explanation:
Dean Saunders.

	Saunders caused controversy when he was transferred from Oxford United to Derby County. The two clubs were owned by Robert Maxwell.

questions.text: Cannes - Bordeaux - Juventus - Real Madrid?
questions.explanation:
Zinedine Zidane.

	Zidane has won World and European player of the year awards.

questions.text: Vasco de Gama - PSV Eindhoven - Barcelona - Flamengo - Valencia - Fluminese - Vasco de Gama - Al Sadd - Fluminese?
questions.explanation:
Romario.

	Romario's full name is Romario de Souza Faria.

questions.text: Montpellier - Napoli - Nimes - Saint Etienne - Auxerre (Loan) - Barcelona - Marseilles - Inter Milan - Manchester United?
questions.explanation:
Laurent Blanc.

	Blanc signed for Manchester United on a free transfer in 2001.

questions.text: Leicester City - Everton - Barcelona - Tottenham Hotspur - Nagoya Grampus 8?
questions.explanation:
Gary Lineker.

	Lineker was a football presenter in the early 2000s.

questions.text: Argentinos Juniors - Boca Juniors - Barcelona - Napoli - Seville - Newell's Old Boys?
questions.explanation:
Diego Maradona.

	Maradona scored the infamous 'Hand of God' goal against England in 1986.

questions.text: Auxerre - Martigues (Loan) - Marseilles - Bordeaux (Loan) - Montpellier - Marseilles - Nimes - Leeds United - Manchester United?
questions.explanation:
Eric Cantona.

	Cantona famously attacked an opposing fan at Crystal Palace while playing for Manchester United. He was later banned for 8 months and sent to prison for 30 days, which was later reduced to community service.

questions.text: Newcastle United - Tottenham Hotspur - Lazio - Rangers - Middlesbrough - Everton - Burnley?
questions.explanation:
Paul Gascoigne.

	'Gazza' was one of England's brightest prospects. Over the years, the talent slowly wasted away.

questions.text: Coventry City - Nottingham Forest - Newcastle United - West Ham United - Manchester City?
questions.explanation:
Stuart Pearce.

	Whilst player-manager of Nottingham Forest, Pearce won the Carling manager and player of the month at the same time.

questions.text: Manchester United - Crewe Alexandra - Aston VIlla - Bari - Juventus - Sampdoria - Arsenal - Nottingham Forest?
questions.explanation:
David Platt.

	Platt started his career at Manchester United. He never played a game.

questions.text: Carlisle United - Vancouver Whitecaps - Manchester United - Vancouver Whitecaps - Newcastle United - Liverpool - Everton - Newcastle United - Bolton Wanderers - Manchester City (Loan) - Fulham - Hartlepool?
questions.explanation:
Peter Beardsley.

	Beardsley made just one appearance for Manchester United, before being released.

questions.text: Toulon - Racing Club Paris - Brest - Paris Saint Germain - Newcastle United - Tottenham Hotspur - Aston Villa - Everton?
questions.explanation:
David Ginola.

	Ginola only played 32 times in 2 seasons at Aston Villa before being shown the door and transferred to Everton.

questions.text: Borussia Monchengladbach - Bayern Munich - Inter Milan - Bayern Munich - Metro Stars - Rapid Vienna?
questions.explanation:
Lothar Matthaus.

	In the 1999 European Cup Final, Matthaus was substituted by Bayern Munich, with his team leading 1-0. They subsequently lost 2-1 to Manchester United with both goals coming in injury time. Manchester United added this trophy to their domestic double of League Championship and FA Cup, and so becoming the first English team do do 'The Treble'.
